alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 11:12AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pinal County through NOON MST... At 1112 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Olberg, or 11 miles south of Sun Lakes. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Maricopa, Olberg, Ak-Chin Village and Sacaton. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 176 and 179. AZ Route 347 between mile markers 168 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
